thread.title: Is there a mistake on your voter card?
thread.title_full: Is there a mistake on your voter card? - NEWS 1130

author: Kenny Mason
title: Is there a mistake on your voter card?
text:
VANCOUVER (NEWS 1130) – Have you received your voter card in the mail and noticed a spelling error? Don’t worry, you still have a few days to fix it.
Your voter card has to match your ID, so spelling mistakes are a problem.
Dorothy Sitek with Elections Canada says if you notice an error, there are some things you can do.
“With the extended election period, we have time now to make changes,” Sitek notes. “If you need any changes made, you will be issued a replacement card as long as you request those changes before October 13th.”
You can use a nickname on your voter card — like Tim, Jim or Jen, for example — versus your legal name, as long as they are not vastly different.
Sitek says if you have any questions, ask your returning officer.
“If you’re not sure, this is a great time to contact your local Elections Canada office. Your local returning officer is the person who can help.”
